https://www.transitchicago.com/ ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†
We are on the RED line. Walk straight up under the tracks next to Target to the brand new Wilson stop. ¬†Or go right to Buena and go left to Sheridan and then right (south) to Irving Park stop. The RED line runs North/South pretty much in a straight line; to the north you can get to Evanston from Red to Purple line. Or transfer to Brown line by heading south and Brown line takes you in a loop of Chicago.

https://www.divvybikes.com/ ¬†¬†¬†
Bike Rentals are convenient too.
Cabs and Ubers are easy and readily available in most spots. Chicago is also a wonderful walking city.
house_rules:
When you make a booking you acknowledge that you have read ALL the details of this listing.  We additionally require you to read the following and write back to us in Airbnb messages, "I have read and will follow the House Rules":

HOUSE RULES:

We do not rent to locals without prior approval. If you instant book and are local your reservation will be canceled. All local inquires must get approval first before booking. Minimum age to book this unit is 25 years old. You must provide a copy of a Government-Issued Photo ID with address of the Primary Guest to us (the Host) before you will be allowed access. Hotels require this. So do we. 

Download the August Home app on your mobile device. August Home is a Smartlock that uses Bluetooth through your phone to unlock the unit.

Provide US with First/Last names AND phone numbers of those staying in the unit.

You will be granted access to the unit once you complete #1 to #6 listed above.

Please clean your dishes and put them away. Please do not rinse food down the drain. There is no garbage disposal so please put food in the garbage and then clean the dishes.

Please remove all garbage from the unit.

NO DYING HAIR IN UNIT. 

NO EXTRA GUESTS. 

NO SPECIAL EVENTS.

NO GLITTER.

Back door and laundry key are on the key hook on wall when you first walk in on your right. Take it to remove garbage so you can get back in. If you don't, you'll be locked out and have to walk around again.

Please place all towels and linens in the laundry basket in closet.

Also please remove all food and drinks you bring into the unit. 

Parking. Our block of Kenmore from Montrose to Buena is permit free with 2 exceptions:
1. St. Mary's school at Buena and Kenmore have CLEARLY displayed signs from Buena to the alley north of the school on Kenmore no parking. Obviously don't park there.
2. Pay attention to street cleaning signs or possible construction signs that may be posted on tree trunks or street poles. It is upon you to make sure these types of signs are not going to warrant you getting ticket.

Dial 911 for Emergencies
Fire Department (312) 745-3705  
Fire Extinguisher is located under the kitchen sink.
interaction: Please ask Tara our Co-Host to respond to any questions you have prior, during, and after check-in or check-out.  Thanks!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Chicago! You are in a great city, and a good spot. You can walk to Wrigley. There are lots to do in Wrigley. Boystown is just east of Wrigley. North of us, is Uptown with music venues, restaurants and bars- 

The Green Mill is a famous spot. http://greenmilljazz.com/

Ravenswood and Lincoln Square are not far either.

I recommend Ubering or taking a cab home from here at night. 

Chicago has great museums, theaters, food, and nightlife. ¬†Shedd Aquarium is awesome. ¬†

Be sure to check out the park alongside the lake. It has a bike path, running path, a skate board park is very close to this location, and beaches at Montrose and Foster. Lake Michigan never gets very warm so prepare before you jump in.

Please sign our guest book with notes about where you are from, why you are here and what you would recommend to other guests. 

Chicago can be expensive but there are a lot of things you can do for free. Here are some. Lincoln Park Zoo is worth seeing. ¬†

https://www.choosechicago.com/things-to-do/free-and-cheap-things-to-do/

Parking
There is no parking permit required on our block- 4200 N Kenmore. Parking on Sheridan does not require a permit. Buena is problematic as you cannot park there when school is in session. If you park south of Buena, you will need a daily parking permit. Please notify us in advance if you require parking passes. ¬†Do not park behind the building; you will be towed and possibly get car covered in grease from track.

Transportation
https://www.transitchicago.com/ ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†
We are on the RED line. Walk straight up under the tracks next to Target to the brand new Wilson stop. ¬†Or go right to Buena and go left to Sheridan and then right (south) to Irving Park stop. The RED line runs North/South pretty much in a straight line; to the north you can get to Evanston from Red to Purple line. Or transfer to Brown line by heading south and Brown line takes you in a loop of Chicago.


https://www.divvybikes.com/ ¬†¬†¬†¬†
Bike Rentals are convenient too.

Cabs and Ubers are easy and readily available in most spots. 

Chicago is also a wonderful walking city. 

Shopping 
There is a Jewel Osco (grocery) just 2 blocks from this location. Walk out door and turn left. At Montrose go right toward lake and you will walk to Jewel. 

TIPS from a mom- 
Layer up because you can never predict what weather will do in Chicago. 

Check on line before you come for schedule of events or tickets.
space:
New updated 1 bedroom with all new furniture, appliances, and amenities you'd expect and more.  Ultra clean and comfortably sleeps 2 in bedroom queen bed and 2 on twin futon and twin air mattress in living room.

5 blocks north of Wrigley Field, close to Lake Michigan, steps from public transportation, hopping nightlife, restaurants, etc.

Perfect for couples, groups up to 4, solo adventurers, and business travellers.  On a quiet tree lined street, escape into The Wrigley Retreat.
summary: Brand new updated and refurbished 1 bedrooom unit is located 5 blocks from Wrigley Field.  Comfortably sleeps up to 4.  Hop, skip, and jump to vibrant night life in Wrigleyville, Lakeview, Uptown, Ravenswood, and Lincoln Square.

description:
Charming brick wall, balcony, wooden tram apartment in converted biscuit factory building with washer/dryer in unit, and free large fitness facility in building.

In the heart of Chicago with East Bank Club next door (rooftop pools), lots of restaurants, bars,... you definitely will not need a car here.

*Building only allows long-term reservations. Message me for discounts with long-term bookings.

description:
Complete your Chicago experience by staying in this stunning two bedroom apartment with magnificent views. Conveniently situated in South Loop, this luxurious space was designed to make you feel at home. Easily walk to many of Chicago's most famous attractions.  Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of art, culture, and food that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable stay at this Domio.

All Domios are designed with style and comfort in mind and this space is no different. This 2 Bedroom and 2 Bath Domio features a queen sized bed in each room. The first bedroom also has an attached bathroom and there is also a second full bathroom. The spacious living room has a sofa bed and air mattress for added comfort. You can access the outdoor balcony from the living room. There is a washer/dryer in unit for laundry.

Guests have access to the buildings state of the art amenities including:
Fitness Center
Pool
Jacuzzi
Skyview Lounge
Rooftap Terrace
Billiards Lounge
Indoor Basketball Court
Racquetball Court
Yoga Studio
HD Golf Simulator
Putting Green

There‚Äôs no need for us to get in your way of having a good time. If you need anything though - questions, recommendations, or just want to chat - our Domio delighters are always one phone call away!

Chicago Registration Number: Pending

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.

access: There is one parking spot allocated for this unit.
description:
Feel at home in our 3-bedroom flat which sits in the heart of historic Oak Park.  It's only steps away from town center on Lake Street and Oak Park Ave.  It's a bright 1st floor apartment just a short walk (5 mins) from Oak Park's Green line train that goes directly to downtown Chicago.   Directly across from the new "District House" Condos,  the people, the ambiance, and the location can't be beat.  Great for families, business travelers, or friends gathering for a reunion.  Check us out!

What makes our space unique is location, location, location.  

We are located steps away from Lake Street and Oak Park Avenue, doesn't the block from Cheney Mansion, and directly behind Oak Park River Forest High School.

Our 3 bedroom, 1 1/2 bath apartment is in the heart of Oak Park's Shopping and Restaurant District and is 1/2 block away from everything Oak Park.

Our flat is spacious and private.  It has plenty of space for friends and guests; there is a private front and rear entrance, a private yard shared to use with one other Airbnb tenant, and washing facilities on site.  It really is a special place and we hope you enjoy it.

There is one parking spot allocated for this unit.

We are all for privacy and simplicity.  If you want self check-in, it's totally available to you.  We are in town and only a short distance away if something comes up.  Of course, we're always happy to provide information about the area upon request and are here as your hosts.

We love everything about this neighborhood! It's quiet yet in the heard of Oak Park.   All of the homes are +100 years old and meticulously kept. The small residential 3-flat building is one block away from Cheney Mansion and less distance to get to the Main library, park, and central Oak Park‚Äôs Lake Street.

We are 1/2 block away from centralized el/subway and we are a fifteen minute train ride from Chicago's State Street. If you're driving, we are also a short distance away from the Eisenhower Expressway (I-290) and thus a short drive to Michigan Ave in Chicago.  Taxi / Uber are also easily accessible as we live only steps away from Cheney Mansion.

We offer an outdoor grille during the summer months with an eating area if you‚Äôd like.  Our space is centrally located amongst Oak Park‚Äôs largest and most historic homes.  We are casual hosts, we enjoy a carefree lifestyle and often enjoy taking walks in our neighborhood.  Come be our guest.
house_rules:
‚Äî AM Events may be OK with additional information prior to approving.  Parties of any form are not allowed.

‚Äî One parking spot is available with this space however the backyard will be shared with a renter.  

‚Äî

additional_house_rules:
Check In/Check Out may be flexible if agreed upon in advance.

Check In anytime after 3 pm. Please let us know when you book about when you are arriving so we are home to welcome you. If you would like to arrange for an earlier check in, please let us know.

Curfew at 10 pm unless you arrange with host for a later time.

ACCESS - Front Door.

Please remove your shoes in our home (closet for shoes in foyer)

We do not allow pets as we already have small dogs

Registered guests only, please

We live in a residential neighborhood, so we ask that you keep noise to a reasonable level out of respect for our other guests and our neighbors.

We do not allow smoking inside the house, but you are welcome to smoke on the front or back porch.

Check out is at 10 am. This is so we can access the room to change sheets and clean room for the next guest. You are always welcome to stay in the house later, but especially on work days, we will need to access the room early to prepare for a new guest arrival. If you would like a later check out, we will make every possible effort to accommodate.

No meat, poultry or seafood in the house. We are vegetarians. Thank you.

access: Guests will have access to a private bedroom and shared bathroom, WIFI Wireless Internet.
description:
Private queen bedroom on private floor with shared bath in a quiet, safe, comfy home with free parking. We live in quiet neighborhood with a short walk to restaurants/shops and local attractions (Morton Arboretum, Danada House, Science of Spirituality) as well as Colleges (College of Dupage, North Central, Wheaton College) and Universities (Benedictine, Midwestern). Metra - 30 minute express train to downtown BNSF line at Lisle Metra Station or West line at Wheaton and College Avenue Stations).

Our quiet, comfy, Tudor style home will be a peaceful retreat for you especially if traveling for business. We live in private culdesac in a quiet suburban neighborhood which is a close walk to parks, shops, restaurants, pubs, movie theater/cinema, grocery stores like Whole Foods and others. It is an exceptionally great place to stay if you like to bicycle or hike as there are wonderful trails very nearby. If you are looking for more adventure, you can commute to downtown Chicago (30 minutes on express train).

Main close by destinations (within 10-15 minutes):
Wheaton College
Morton Arboretum
Danada House
Benedictine University
College of Dupage
North Central College

Destinations in downtown Chicago (within 30 minutes to an hour depending on mode of transport and timings).
Willis Tower (previously Sears Tower)
John Hancock Building
Navy Pier
Adler Planetarium
John G Shedd Aquarium
Museum of Science and Industry
Field Museum
Art Institute of Chicago
Magnificent Mile (Michigan Avenue)

Shopping
Yorktown Mall (10 minutes)
Oakbrook Center Mall (15 minutes)
Chicago Premium Outlets - top designers at discount prices (15 minutes)
Fashion Outlets of Chicago - destination for designer goods and apparel (25 minutes)

Airports and transportation
O‚ÄôHare International (25 minutes)
Midway (35 minutes)
Lisle Metra Station - BNSF line (7 minutes)
Wheaton Metra Station - West line (10 minutes)
College Avenue Metra Station - West line (10 minutes)

There are many nearby parks and areas for recreation such was Wheaton Park District Rice Pool Center and Gym which you can purchase day passes. The neighborhood is quiet and safe for walking in the evening. Please be respectful of our neighbors and their privacy.

You will have your own private room in our home with a shared bath with other guest(s) on the upstairs floor (if the other adjacent room is booked if not then it will be a private bath). We have another guest room if you would like to book for your guests for your stay. Additional fee for more than 1 guest. If 2 guests please book 2. Thank you.

To book Room In 3, use this web address: 
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/7764474 

To book Room 2, use this web address: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/7805600

AMENITIES: 
The house is equipped with: Happiness :) 
Television with Directv/Amazon Prime/HBO/Showtime
Super fast wireless internet (WiFi)
Central air conditioning (A/C)
Central heat 
Fire Alarm 
Safety smoke and carbon alarms 
Fresh towels 
Iron
Ironing board
Shampoo
Conditioner
Body Wash
Hair dryer 
Closet
Hangers 
Free parking 

We will be available much of the time during your stay. We are here to answer questions and provide any information that will make your stay more enjoyable. While we love to visit and get to know our guests, we will respect your privacy.

Our Chiweenie (Chihuahua/Dachshund mix), Barfi loves people. He does have the run of the house downstairs, however is exclusively with my mother on the main floor as she is in a wheelchair and he is her companion dog. He is very friendly and great with guests.

Guests will have access to a private bedroom and shared bathroom, WIFI Wireless Internet.

We are available to assist guests with any questions they may have and are very friendly, but respect our guests privacy.

Walking distance to movie theater, restaurants, Whole Foods grocery store, nature and hiking/biking trails. Views of the beautiful horse farm and Morton Arboretum from the home. Free parking.

Nearby public transport and quick access to I-355 and I-88 for those with vehicles. Free parking. 
Pace Bus

Taxi
Need a taxi? Flat rate cab is our choice: ((website hidden)) See website. Flat rate taxi rates are as follows: 
O'hare to Wheaton: $37 
Midway to Wheaton: $45 
Chicago Loop to Wheaton: $56 
Otherwise, their local fare rate is $10 within a 5 mile radius. 
Alternatively, you can try out Uber, another app we love to use.

Train
Metra - to Downtown Chicago $6 one-way (discounts for Students and Seniors)
- Lisle train station (BNSF) is a 5 minute drive or taxi ride away
(website hidden)_schedules/metra_system_map/bnsf/map.html
- Wheaton Downtown train station and College Avenue train station (Union Pacific West - UP-W) is a 10 minute drive or taxi ride away
(website hidden)_schedules/metra_system_map/up-w/schedule.html

Rental Car Agencies
Enterprise Rent-A-Car
1712 Ogden Ave
Lisle, IL (phone number hidden)

Budget Lisle IL Rent-A-Car
1400 Corporetum Dr
Lisle, IL (phone number hidden)

If you are new to Airbnb, there are some things you should know about listing your profile and making a request.

AirBnB will block your email, phone number, and personal contact information, so we are unable to communicate other than through Airbnb.

We, like most hosts, love to see profiles which are updated with some more personal information about yourself and a couple forms of verification, especially a verified ID. We like to see that to ensure a measure of security for ourselves and our guests. Once you have stayed with a host, you are rated by the host. That rating helps to increase the appeal of your profile. We are happy to give you any further information you may need.

We have a curfew of 10pm. If you are going to be coming home late, please arrange with us in advance.

description:
Brand new service property. Beautiful single family house in a very convenient and safe Chicago west suburb, Forest Park. This cute bedrm has the size of 5'4" by 11'8", and has ample space to fit in a twin size bed and a work desk. This room is very economical and is specially designed for thrift travelers. It has all the basic plus common areas such as living & dining rm, kitchen, and laundry area.

Close to public trans & I-290 exprwy. 15 min to downtown via train & 15 min by car (normal traffic). Clse to Loyola Med Ctr, Hines VA & Rush Hsptls.

access:
Each guest will get personal Wishbox portal on their phone, where you will be able to see all the information you need for your trip, book early check-in or late check-out, reserve fun tours and activities or buy souvenirs  

All our locks digital so you would not need keys. You will have 3 apartments all to yourself. which is complete with living room TV ( Netflix, Amazon Prime and more ) kitchen and working space + FREE private parking in the back of the building.  We also offer 3D movies.
description:
If you like a unique vibe, good energy, cool experience, eat or learn how to make Sushi or European food, wine, smoothies, fun activities, and tours or just relax in the front of the tv our home is for you! 

If you like someone to cook for you during your stay breakfast, lunch or dinner or take cooking/language classes also available. ¬†For families with kids, we offer babysitter options inside of your apartment you will stay.¬† All our locks to apartments and rooms are digital so you would not need to worry about security & keys.

Property professionally managed by Ran Fridman - Airbnb Superhost with more than 15 years of experience in the Hospitality Industry worldwide. ¬†We take care of each guest like Family, come and experience our hospitality. 

Thank You and we're looking forward to hosting you, my friend,¬†

Fridman Properties Family

This listing is perfect option for very big groups, families, students, organize events and family gatherings. This listing for 3 apartments in same building total of 8 bedrooms, 6 bathrooms, 3 living rooms, 3 kitchens and can accommodate up to 20 guests.  

Sleeping arrangements are  3 queen size beds, 4 twin size beds, 12 bunk beds, 3 couches and the rest are air mattresses. Please note smoking allowed on the porch or outside NOT inside of the apartment. 

We offer everything, from cellphone chargers, washer and dryer, printers, hairdryers, umbrellas, irons, and all the necessary toiletries, including even makeup removal. 

Come and enjoy our hospitality & see why our guests keep coming back. 

Fridman Properties

Each guest will get personal Wishbox portal on their phone, where you will be able to see all the information you need for your trip, book early check-in or late check-out, reserve fun tours and activities or buy souvenirs  

All our locks digital so you would not need keys. You will have 3 apartments all to yourself. which is complete with living room TV ( Netflix, Amazon Prime and more ) kitchen and working space + FREE private parking in the back of the building.  We also offer 3D movies.

We love to help visitors!  We take care of each guest like family.  We want your experience in Chicago to be AWESOME.  Please see our guest‚Äôs feedback & testimonies; actual clients who stayed with us.  We assist students, faculty and visitors with many other services as well ... like helping  you to find long term rentals if you are relocating, room rentals for functions, meetings and study rooms, airport pick up & drop off services, storage space, moving, renting or buying furniture,  shopping, driving lessons, opening bank accounts and much more!  Please contact us for complete details.  We are here to help you to focus on studying, working or to simply have a great time doing what you love to do best!  We also offer 50% off on special tickets to the Science and Industry Museum + FREE parking and even 3D movies for your entertainment.  We sincerely hope you will have a truly pleasant stay with us.

Thank You,
Ran & Family

Near historical Washington Park, University of Chicago and within walking distance to Garfield Green Line train station which will take you 20-25 minutes to McCormick Place and 30-35 minutes to Downtown Chicago for only $2.50 per train ride.

Inside our apartments we provide local guidebooks offering suggestions on "where to eat, where to go, what to see, and schedules for up-coming events."

Our property is right off I-90/94 highway, only 4 blocks from Garfield (Green) Station CTA, which will take you to McCormick Place in 20-25 minutes and the University of Chicago shuttle bus also stops nearby.

We provide transportation from the airport for your safety and convenience for only $69.00 and someone will even meet and greet you at the airport baggage area to help you carry your bags.  We want you to fully enjoy your stay with us, worry free.

We also enjoy helping students, faculties, and visitors with many other various services, like helping  you to find long term rentals if you are relocating, room rentals for functions, meetings and study rooms, airport pick up & drop off service, storage space, moving, renting or buying furniture,  shopping, driving lessons, opening bank accounts and much more.  Contact us for full details.  We're here to help you focus on studying, working or to simply have a good time doing what you love to do.  We want you to remember and enjoy your stay with us.

additional_house_rules:
SAMPLE: CHICAGO GUEST HOUSE RENTAL AGREEMENT
BE ASSURED WHEN WRITING the POLICIES; MY #1 GOAL is CUSTOMER SATISFACTION for ALL MY GUESTS. 
All Guest will be required to agree to the stipulation/terms of this rental agreement (SAMPLE BELOW) prior to your stay. It will be emailed to you for signature through Docusign¬Æ. Please review CAREFULLY so as not to have any misunderstandings. In the event you as the signer of this rental agreement feel you cannot vouch for ALL MEMBERS of YOUR party (support as being true, certain, reliable); I would suggest you consider alternative accommodations.
SUMMARY:
‚Ä¢	AGE RESTRICTIONS: 28 ---We are a FAMILY FRIENDLY establishment‚ÄîALL Children are welcome when accompanied by a parent or guardian. EXCEPTIONS can be made. Contact Teri/Owner: (312) 952-5150
‚Ä¢	NO SMOKING WITHIN 15‚Äô OF THE BUILDING
‚Ä¢	NO PETS
‚Ä¢	NOT to EXCEED MAXIMUM CAPACITY OF THE UNIT. Due City of Chicago Fire Ordinance---Max capacity is not to include sleeping on the floor (air mattresses, sleeping bags, etc) There are no sleeper sofas---couches are not to be used as beds.
‚Ä¢	QUIET TIME: To provide a positive experience for all guests. PATIO/GARDEN 10pm Sun-Thur. 12pm Friday/Saturday.

These are multi-unit buildings, I do my BEST to make sure the buildings are booked with groups having ‚ÄòLIKE DYNAMICS‚Äô---families with children with other families with children. Young adults with other young adults, seniors with other seniors, etc. This policy helps to better insure that everyone staying in the home will have a positive enjoyable experience.

1.  NO SMOKING: Smoking is strictly prohibited ANYWHERE inside the building, front porches or enclosed back porches or within 15' of any entry door, window or ventilation intake. Disposing of cigar/cigarette butts on the property (lawns, flowerbeds, flower pots, driveways, parkways, etc.) WILL NOT be tolerated. Ashtrays are provided for guests. Cigarette butts littering the yard, flower beds, sidewalks in front of the home will result in the forfeiture of $500 damage deposit and all Guests in the party will be asked to vacate the property.
2.  NO PETS of any kind are allowed anywhere on the property. Pets found on the property will result in the forfeiture of $500 damage deposit and all Guest in the party will be asked to vacate the property.
3.  MAXIMUM CAPACITY (6): Lessee agrees they will not exceed the maximum capacity for the apartment. Each member of the Lessees party MUST be at least 28 years of age (When in doubt Guests may be asked for I.D.) ‚ÄîALL CHILDREN ARE WELCOME WHEN ACCOMPANIED BY PARENT or GUARDIAN. Exceptions made on case by case basis. ASK OWNER. Chicago Guest House makes every effort to book each building with group having 'SIMILAR DYNAMICS' in order to reduce any unnecessary disturbances, thus any Lessee who misrepresents their group is consider in breach of this contract; Chicago Guest House LLC reserves the right to refuse occupancy or have the property vacated for lease violations. All money applied toward the lease will be forfeited.
4.  NO DRUGS USE: No drugs of any kind to be used on the property. Drug use on the property will result in the forfeiture of $500 damage deposit all Guest in party will be asked to vacate the property.
5. TRASH DISPOSAL: Chicago Guest House does NOT provide daily cleaning services. Lessee agrees to keep the common areas (back porches, yard, and patios) free and clear of trash and any dining ware.  (Cans, bottles, trash bags, dishes, glasses, etc.)  NEVER LEAVE TRASH on the back porches, patios, hallways. It attracts bugs! Trash receptacles are located in the alley behind the garage. Blue for recycling, black for all other garbage.
6. CONDUCT: Lessee assures that he/she and their guests who occupy the property during the term of the lease will conduct themselves in a manner that is respectful and inoffensive to the neighbors and other Tenants in the building. They shall not disturb, annoy, endanger or inconvenience the neighbors in any way. 
CUSTOMER SATISFACTION is MY MAIN GOAL: In the event I receive any complaints from the neighbors next door to the building or neighbors inside of the building for loud or offensive behavior or any violations to the terms of this rental agreement you will be asked to leave the property.
a. No loud music inside of the home or in the yard
b. Entertaining in the garden/patio/yard no later than 10pm Sunday-Thursday | 12 midnight Friday & Saturday. No level of noise in or outside the apartment that would prevent someone from sleeping. 
c. No parties or gatherings beyond maximum capacity of the unit without prior consent from owner.
7.  Refunds: Chicago Guest House LLC, will make every effort to ensure all equipment (mechanicals, electrical equipment, cable, etc.) is kept in good working order at all times however, it is impossible to guarantee this.  In the event a repair or replacement is found necessary, Chicago Guest House LLC will make every effort to have such repairs made within 24 hours of the report (during normal business hours) Please report inoperative equipment promptly. Refunds/allowances will be granted ONLY if the property is unfit and uninhabitable. The malfunction of mechanicals (air conditioner/furnace/water heaters, etc.) appliances (stove, refrigerators/freezers, microwaves, etc.) electrical equipment (TV, Stereo, DVD, etc. plumbing or noise will not automatically render the property unfit and uninhabitable.  Bathroom plumbing issue resulting from the disposal of anything other than toilet tissue will be considered negligent behavior by Lessee and/or his/her guests.  No feminine products, baby wipes, cloth of any kind, food diapers, or other misc. items shall be flushed in the toilets. Any cost related to the remedy of the problem will be deducted for the damage deposit. No amenities are guaranteed. In the event Chicago Guest House is unable to remedy the problem within 24 hours (business hours) we will relocated. the Lessee to a comparable Chicago Guest House managed property. If no property is available, it is the Lessee's responsibility to find alternate accommodations: Lessee expressly acknowledges that Chicago Guest House is NOT responsible for any expense incurred as a result of relocation to another hotel/property.
8.  LEAVE IT AS YOU FOUND IT: Lessee is expected to leave the property (with the exception of the laundering of linens & towels) in the condition it was when he/she took occupancy. Maintaining the property in good order and appearance. All fees for cleaning services above and beyond the ‚Äònormal' scope of cleaning will be deducted from the damage deposit. EXAMPLE: Steam cleaning /shampooing carpets, rugs, drapes, curtains, mattresses, furniture, etc.  AS A COURTESY---IN THE EVENT YOU BELIEVE the unit will require a repair or cleaning services please contact us IMMEDIATELY, so we can remedy BEFORE the next group checks in. 
9.  Lessee agrees to indemnify and save Teresa A. Smith and/or Paul J. Kelly harmless from all liability, loss or damage arising from any nuisance or harm made or suffered on the premises by his/her Guests from and carelessness, neglect or improper conduct of any persons entering, occupying or visiting the lease premises. In the event that any action shall be commended by either party arising out of or concerning this lease or any right or obligation derived there from the prevailing party shall be entitled to receive attorney's fees as fixed by the Court for all relief at law or equity. Lessee assumes full responsibility for fulfilling the terms of the lease for the period stated and assures Chicago Guest House LLC full recourse for the payment of any amount outstanding.
10.  Chicago Guest house LLC requires their employees to monitor the adherence to the terms of the lease agreement.  Employees of Chicago Guest House are on site each day to maintain the property.  Any employee/contractor of Chicago Guest House LLC WILL be granted access to the home at ANY TIME for 'reasonable suspicion' of a lease violation or necessary repairs. Lease violations will be result in your party being vacated from the property.

access: COMMON AREA: Garden and Garage
description:
You‚Äôll immediately feel at ease in this warm & welcoming, thoughtfully decorated Chicago Guest House vacation rental home in Chicago‚Äôs lively Wrigleyville neighborhood!  Comfortably furnished & fully equipped; the PERFECT lodging choice for business & leisure travelers looking for a ‚ÄòHome Away from Home‚Äô in Chicago. Guaranteed to exceed your expectations. That is my promise!

Teri Smith
Chicago Guest House LLC

This is NOT my personal residence.
This property is used STRICTLY as a vacation/corporate rental. 
You will NOT find any of my 'personal items' in the home--EVER. 
Meticulously maintained--extremely clean and comfortable.

COMMON AREA: Garden and Garage

Lakeview's Wrigleyville is one of Chicago's liveliest and most vibrant neighborhoods. Several distinct areas all meld together to form a family friendly community that celebrates diversity and boasts something for every type of visitor. 

Southport Corridor Shopping---Hit the bustling commercial shopping districts on Southport Ave, Belmont & Halstead Streets for those one of a kind finds!

Wrigleyville Restaurants---Live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless bars and pubs, and celebrated restaurants; the dining choices are endless! 

Lakeview / Wrigleyville Arts and Culture----live music venues, several summer street festivals and a thriving scene for theater, dance and comedy.  

Wrigley Field and 'The Park at Wrigley'---home to our beloved Chicago Cubs! Even if you don't spend the afternoon watching a game, you don't want to miss strolling over to the corner of Clark & Addison to see one of baseball's oldest ballparks nestled amongst the historic greystones that  make up this amazing neighborhood!  And you don't want to miss the events at The Park all year long! Walk 3 Blocks to Wrigley Field

Chicago's Lakefront---not to be outdone by its extraordinary entertainment landscape, Lakeview makes full use of the northern end of Lincoln Park.  Enjoy the the scenic Lakefront Trail, a golf course and so much more!

5 MIN WALK TO WRIGLEY FIELD
RED LINE at ADDISON/SHEFFIELD
BROWN LINE at SOUTHPORT / ROSCOE: Walk 5 blocks South
Both direct to downtown.

additional_house_rules:
1. You‚Äôre living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c‚Äômon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn‚Äôt super awesome? 

2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We‚Äôre super sorry if this is a bummer, but it‚Äôs our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren‚Äôt super surprised that we still mean it. 

3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren‚Äôt allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal then give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.  

4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren‚Äôt, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What‚Äôs a little information between friends?  

5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you‚Äôre responsible for their actions.  

6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilarious, there are occupancy rules Stay Alfred must follow for each of our buildings. Help us follow the rules and check your rental contract for occupancy requirements. If you exceed it, don‚Äôt worry! Give us a call and we‚Äôll get you one of our bigger travel apartments. (It‚Äôs like needing an Uber XL when you have a ton of people with you!) 

7. We‚Äôre here to help! The onsite building staff doesn‚Äôt work for Stay Alfred‚Ä¶strange, right? So, if you need something, send us a chat, or just give us a call. Our awesome Guest Services department will assist you 24/7.

8. Take only memories, leave only the keys, fobs, parking passes, etc. behind. They won‚Äôt help you out when you get home and it‚Äôs a total pain to have to replace them. 

9. We love gifts, but the greatest gift is making sure you don‚Äôt leave anything behind. We suggest taking one last look around before you head home as fees are associated with sending you your belongings. Trust us, the extra five minutes is worth it! 

10. Ugh, here‚Äôs the hard one. Should you break anything, really mess something up, or decide to stay longer than your agreed upon length of stay, we have the right to charge you additional fees, but we‚Äôd really rather not (and, we‚Äôre sure you‚Äôd rather not too!)

11. Guests must be 21 years of age or older to make a Reservation, and the Guest who made the Reservation must be present for the duration of the stay. If the Guest who made the Reservation isn‚Äôt present during the stay, occupants may be removed from the Rental Unit, and the Reservation may be canceled without refund.

description:
Upscale travel apartments featuring full kitchens and high-end amenities in the heart of Chicago‚Äôs South Loop

These stylish South Loop travel apartments are the perfect home base for any trip to Chicago, whether you‚Äôre coming to town on business or for a vacation with the fam. Nestled between Chi-Town highlights like the Field Museum and sprawling Grant Park, every apartment features a spacious floor plan, a full kitchen with modern appliances, and essentials like cable TV and free, fast WiFi. The building certainly doesn‚Äôt skimp on the amenities either, with a resident lounge, business center, and a sunny rooftop deck with barbecue stations.

We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should you need us, we‚Äôre here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don‚Äôt need us, we‚Äôll stay out of your way. After all, this is your place in the city.

Chicago‚Äôs South Loop neighborhood is home to some of the city‚Äôs top things to do and places to eat - with a more laid-back atmosphere than the hustling, bustling Magnificent Mile. In this hip district, you‚Äôll find enormous, green parks like the Museum Campus and Northerly Island (not to mention Grant Park!) and streets that are a pedestrian‚Äôs dream with nice wide sidewalks. Cultural attractions abound, from the Field Museum to the Adler Planetarium to arts venues like the intimate M Lounge and storied Arie Crown Theater.

We furnish all of our properties to a uniform standard, but individual units may differ slightly from the pictures shown.
house_rules:
1. You‚Äôre living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c‚Äômon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn‚Äôt super awesome? 

2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We‚Äôre super sorry if this is a bummer, but it‚Äôs our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren‚Äôt super surprised that we still mean it. 

3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren‚Äôt allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal then give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.  

4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren‚Äôt, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What‚Äôs a little information between friends?  

5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you‚Äôre responsible for their actions.  

6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilarious, there are occupancy rules Stay Alfred must follow for each of our buildings. Help us follow the rules and check your rental contract for occupancy requirements. If you exceed it, don‚Äôt worry! Give us a call and we‚Äôll get you one of our bigger travel apartments. (It‚Äôs like needing an Uber XL when you have a ton of people with you!) 

7. We‚Äôre here to help! The onsite building staff doesn‚Äôt work for Stay Alfred‚Ä¶strange, right? So, if you need something, send us a chat, or just give us a call. Our awesome Guest Services department will assist you 24/7.

8. Take only memories, leave only the keys, fobs, parking passes, etc. behind. They won‚Äôt help you out when you get home and it‚Äôs a total pain to have to replace them. 

9. We love gifts, but the greatest gift is making sure you don‚Äôt leave anything behind. We suggest taking one last look around before you head home as fees are associated with sending you your belongings. Trust us, the extra five minutes is worth it! 

10. Ugh, here‚Äôs the hard one. Should you break anything, really mess something up, or decide to stay longer than your agreed upon length of stay, we have the right to charge you additional fees, but we‚Äôd really rather not (and, we‚Äôre sure you‚Äôd rather not too!)

11. Guests must be 21 years of age or older to make a Reservation, and the Guest who made the Reservation must be present for the duration of the stay. If the Guest who made the Reservation isn‚Äôt present during the stay, occupants may be removed from the Rental Unit, and the Reservation may be canceled without refund.

access: I live on the upstairs floor. There is a private gate that separates the lower and upper floors.  Your floor has a master bedroom & connected bathroom.  Right outside your bedroom is my living room with extra plush sofas and a huge TV with full cable and pre-programmed Hulu and Netflix --- you're welcome to use it during the duration of your stay but please use minimal volume after 11pm.  Also enjoy my outdoor patio to grill, or relax in my chaise lounge or hammock, or sit and look at the stars at the LED lit table.  Shared spaces are living room, gym, and patio.
description:
Come and go as you please through your own PRIVATE FLOOR with your OWN ENTRANCE and a beautifully remodeled master bedroom and connected bathroom... LESS THAN 1 MIN WALKING TO WRIGLEY, LAKEVIEW, BOYSTOWN! Kitchenette with microwave, coffee maker & full-size fridge. Share large living room with state-of-the-art HDTV, extra high ceilings, fully-equipped gym, & outdoor patio with lights & hammock. You WON'T find a larger more private space! Host has 670+ 5-STAR reviews!!! Parking available for fee.

The space is part of my duplex which is a two-story condo. Your room is on its own floor and has its own entrance, and the floors are separated by a privacy gate at the foot of the staircase.  The space has massive 10 foot high ceilings, rich Portofino porcelain flooring, a large master bedroom with luxury mattress, a walk-in closet, an en-suite bathroom with modern Grohe fixtures and bathrobe, a wet bar / mini kitchenette with a stainless steel modern backsplash in a wet bar with microwave, coffee maker, and tea kettle, extra spacious living room with cozy plush furniture, art prints and exotic sculptures from every section of the world from my various travels, soft textured rugs, dozens of warm and ultra plush throws, and light-filtering solar shades in my living room.... you will love your surroundings and feel not only at home, but in a relaxing and modern sanctuary.  Keep your fitness goals and share my dedicated gym area with elliptical machine for your daily cardio , free weights, kettlebells, resistance bands, and weight bench.

I live on the upstairs floor. There is a private gate that separates the lower and upper floors.  Your floor has a master bedroom & connected bathroom.  Right outside your bedroom is my living room with extra plush sofas and a huge TV with full cable and pre-programmed Hulu and Netflix --- you're welcome to use it during the duration of your stay but please use minimal volume after 11pm.  Also enjoy my outdoor patio to grill, or relax in my chaise lounge or hammock, or sit and look at the stars at the LED lit table.  Shared spaces are living room, gym, and patio.

I am always available by text/call and have a whole host of recommendations - whether down the street venues, or acclaimed restaurants, or the "see and be seen" trendy spots, or not-to-miss dives, or hole-in-the-wall hidden gems.  I love this city and can proudly claim to know almost every neighborhood intimately.  Please let me know if you have any special requests - beverages, restaurant reservations, package delivery, etc.  I want your stay to be the absolute best!

The population of Wrigleyville/East Lakeview swells during beautiful summer afternoons and evening while the Cubs are at home (making the parking impossible and towing imminent). To avoid the crowds, walk the pleasant, pretty streets during away games. Try Clark Street for rows and rows AND rows of sports bars and airy patio dining and Southport Avenue for quieter date- and family-friendly establishments.  

Wrigleyville is adjacent to East Lakeview aka Boystown, home to a large and vibrant gay community, East Lakeview is brimming with great shopping and dining. The Chicago summer festival season piques in Boystown with the annual Pride Parade and the equally flamboyant Halsted Street Market Days. The neighborhood quiets down a bit in the beautiful gray- and brownstone-lined blocks south of Belmont.  East Lakeview's nightlife is unquestionably the most fun you'll have in the city. Dining options run the gauntlet from ultra chic to comfortably casual.

To the other side of Lakeview is the tan, fit, stroller-pushing set rule in Roscoe Village and West Lakeview.  The Southport Corridor rivals the boutique window-shopping streets of Lincoln Park and Wicker Park. The north side jewel is populated with gray- and brownstones, lush, tiny green lawns, funky boutiques, expensive grocery stores and cozy neighborhood restaurants.

Parking options: Avoid the outrageous parking fee for Cubs Games or concerts.  You can rent a PRIVATE PARKING space from the building management (ranging from $25-$45/day depending on Cubs games) where you will have a dedicated in/out spot during your stay for heavily discounted rates. Inquire within. Or choose to purchase STREET PARKING PERMITS.

You will find that my apartment is located walking distance from everything and everywhere you want to explore -- Lake Michigan, Boystown, Wrigley Field, Southport Corridor, and the famous mile of Wrigley Bars.  

The Red Line stations closest are Belmont and Addison.  The Brown line closest station is Southport.  

Lincoln Park is a short 15-20 minutes walk.  Downtown/The Loop is a short 15 minute train ride.  Within the city, Uber Pool / Lyft Line takes you anywhere in prices ranging from $3-8.

The Red Line stations closest are Belmont and Addison.  The Brown line closest station is Southport.  

Lincoln Park is a short 15-20 minutes walk.  Downtown/The Loop is a short 15 minute train ride.  Within the city, Uber Pool / Lyft Line takes you anywhere in prices ranging from $3-8.

Please check out over 630 reviews averaging 5.0 stars on Airbnb across my other listings in Chicago for a better idea of the quality, essence, and hospitality of my Airbnb listings.... you will be in good hands! All weekend stays less than 3 nights between April-October will be assessed a small 20% surcharge.  All weekend stays less than 3 nights between November-March will be assessed a small 10% surcharge.  All holiday stays (Christmas, New Year's, Thanksgiving, Labor Day, Memorial Day) less than 4 nights will incur a 20% surcharge.

Bookings less than 4 nights during Northalsted Market Days festival will incur a 25% surcharge.  

Same day bookings made AFTER 2pm, may require some flexibility for time of check in. Inquire at time of booking.

For all long-term stays (longer than 15 days), an ongoing cleaning fee will be applied equal to the original cleaning fee at every 15-day interval.

The Red Line stations closest are Belmont and Addison.  The Brown line closest station is Southport.

access: Our guests have full private access to the second floor apartment, including laundry facilities for extended stay guests!  Guests have the ability to adjust the heating/air conditioning to their own comfort levels with NEST thermostat.
description:
Fabulous bright/sunny 6 rm apartment is walking distance to Northwestern Campus, downtown Evanston, & fast public transportation (to Chicago). This large beautiful apartment has a pvt.  entrance & 2 pvt. bedrooms plus a 75" OLED Samsung Color T.V.  Apt. also has 1-1/2 private bathrooms.  This lovely apt. comfortably accommodates (sleeps) 5 guests.  The unit has a Large living room w/gas fireplace, dining room and a fully equipped kitchen, cozy sunroom,  separate  office,  and a  outdoor patio.

This beautiful large second floor apartment has it's own private front and rear entrance.  Relax and enjoy the 75" OLED color TV with over 50 public channels, or watch Amazon Prime and Netflix programs.  The large kitchen is fully equipped for those who enjoy the art of cooking and dining at home.  We provide everything you need for a comfortable stay including a Toaster, Coffee maker, (Coffee/Tea/Sugar/Sweet&Low provided), gas stove, microwave oven and dishwasher. There is a private Wi-Fi to use for pleasure or business in the sunny office. All linens provided for both the 2 Queen sized beds and the full sized Futon.  Complimentary shampoo/conditioner, lotion, toothpaste.  There is a hair dryer, iron and ironing board also provided.  Normal breakfast provided.  I.e. Bacon, eggs, bread, juice, milk, cereal and in-season fruit.

Our guests have full private access to the second floor apartment, including laundry facilities for extended stay guests!  Guests have the ability to adjust the heating/air conditioning to their own comfort levels with NEST thermostat.

I live in the building and my son and his family live in Evanston, and we are happy to help with anything you may need.

The neighborhood is a very quiet treelined residential neighborhood with plenty of free available street parking.  There is a small neighborhood park/playground a block away. Evanston offers a huge variety of exciting restaurants and local breweries, walking distance away from your front door.  You can also find clothing, jewelry, bookstores, sporting goods, boutique and grocery shopping most within  walking distance from your apartment.

You will be walking distance to Downtown Evanston, Evanston Main Library, Northwestern University, Lake Michigan beach and boat launch, renowned restaurants and movie theater.  Walk to CTA/Metra for easy access to downtown Chicago and Ravinia.  Chicago's famous Botanic Gardens is a 20 minute drive.

I have lived in Evanston for over 40 yrs and can recommend restaurants, biking and walking paths as well as many of the tourist attractions,  museums, and  other amenities of the amazing City of Chicago!

description:
Arbor House is nested in a quiet, secure location centrally located residential neighborhood in a Suburb of Chicago in Naperville-Lisle Suburb.  Click profile to see other rooms at Arbor House.

The property is surrounded by 36-miles of Nature,  cycling/Jogging/walking trails and shopping centers. 

20 miles from Midway International Airport, and 24 miles from  O'Hare International Airport. 

We speak your language!  Arbor House *  Naperville-Lisle has been welcoming guests since Dec 2007.

Just walking distance to Benedictine University...  other universities are with 3-5 miles... College of Dupage 3-miles,   North Central College, DeVry University, Robert Morris University.   8-minutes to Downtown Naperville... and the infamous bi-centennial beach and river-walk. 

Just minutes from major business and shopping centers. 28-minutes to the magnificent mile and Chicago's Loop by Train & 35-minutes by car.

All areas except 1st floor private room, other guest rooms, basement and garage.

Host will meet guest to exchange access code & orientation.
Preferred method of contact; Airbnb Email

This home is surrounded by twenty-eight miles of trails allow for hiking, jogging, or biking. Seventeen public parks offer facilities such as playgrounds, tennis courts, basketball courts, and ball fields.   Extensive common areas, jogging and biking throughout the private subdivision.  Golf, skiing and other activities nearby. 

Residential neighborhoods are nestled within 744 acres that include nine lakes, mature woods, grassy open spaces, gentle hills and flatland. There are many recreational opportunities within the subdivision itself.  

Walking distance to Benedictine University...  other universities ar with 3-5 miles... College of Dupage 3-miles,   North Central College, DeVry University, Robert Morris University. 

Convenient to office complexes of the I-88 Corporate Corridor, and to commuter rail and highway networks connecting Chicago and surrounding suburbs.

Approximately 30 miles west of Chicago Loop, the area has quick access to Interstates 88 and 355 and public transportation is also available.  Nearby shopping, the Arboretum and other attractions.

10-Minutes from the Metrarail Station...
Grocery and shopping centers within minutes.
O'hare and Midway Airport 30-40 minutes away.

No Bare Feet-Indoor Footwear-All Household Zones including bedrooms. Complimentary slippers available.

- Quiet Meditation Environment ( 12 Midnight- 6AM )
- - Leave Shoes at Door - "Indoor footwear require" ALL ZONES NO BARE FEET
- - No Unregistered Guest on premise

* Additional cleaning fees apply if kitchenette and/or appliances are not left in same condition as upon use.

access:
During the stay, guests can access:
-Private guest bedroom
-Living room
-Kitchen
-Bathroom
-Laundry room
description:
Bucktown gem with modern comforts. Our condo is on the top floor of a traditional neighborhood 2 flat low-rise. Space includes a comfy sectional couch for TV & relaxing; farmhouse-inspired kitchen to cook meals; beautifully renovated bathroom; and private bedroom with a comfy bed. We're a stone's throw away from Starbucks and The Map Room. Located a few miles northwest of downtown, Bucktown has superb local fare and nightlife. Guests welcome regardless of orientation, religion, ethnicity, etc.

Our condo is homey and sprinkled with quirky, fun accents. Settle in and enjoy your stay‚Ä¶

Check-in is easy. A main building key is needed to enter and is the same for the front door, parking lot gate door and back building door. On the frontside of the building, locate the lock box hanging to the right of the front gate and enter the code provided before your arrival. Once inside, head to the second floor and find the purple door. To enter the apartment, use the keyless entry pad. Press the Schlage logo and then enter the code provided. 

During the day, the chaise couch is wonderful for relaxing and looking out the window. There‚Äôs a beautiful large tree that provides privacy and draws birds in for watching. Say hello to Morticia, our 13 y/o turtle. She lives in her hut and comes out to sunbathe midday, when her sun lamp turns on. 

Enjoy Apple TV with access to favorites like Netflix, Hulu, Bravo, HBO and Prime Video, or listen to any of our favorite vinyls. Other games & entertainment: Nintendo NES Classic, Nintendo Switch, PS4, adult coloring books, board games. Extra comfy blankets for napping in the basket under the sofa table. 

If cooking is your speed, there are gadgets and gear at your disposal. Dishwasher available for faster clean-up, and our favorite grocer is just 0.5 mile away. Feel free to use any spices, oils, vinegars in the cabinets. We are a coffee-loving house hold. Mugs and all the coffee essentials are above the coffee maker.

The bathroom was recently renovated and has some unique highlights. Reclaimed wood shelves, Dyson Supersonic hair dryer and adjustable shower head. The toilet paper holder is custom-made and slides in/out. Be gentle as it‚Äôs easy glide‚Ä¶doesn‚Äôt need much force! Shower and bathroom supplies are on the tray in the guest room.

(Our smart lights, EcoBee and unit front door lock are controlled via Apple Home app. If you're an iPhone user and familiar with the Home app, we can offer access upon request.)

During the stay, guests can access:
-Private guest bedroom
-Living room
-Kitchen
-Bathroom
-Laundry room

We understand some prefer to be left alone when traveling. So, feel comfortable asking for personal space, neighborhood tips or a pal with whom to grab a drink. We love this neighborhood as well as our home and are happy to be your local guides if requested!

If you research Bucktown, there are some seriously odd and taudry stories from times past. However, it's now regarded as one of the fun, quirky and bustling neighborhoods in West Town North area. Neighborhood architecture once focused on mid-rise buildings, but is now sprinkled with modern high rise build-ups. The neighborhood is highly walkable with fun bars, dining options of all kinds and great brunch spots. Holstein Park is a 5 minute walk north, and if you're into free live music, comedy and/or spoken word, check out a Chicago institution - Gallery Cabaret. If you like local neighborhood joints, grab a great cocktail at Charleston bar ... a few blocks up the street.

If driving, we're a 0.25 mile from the highway and street parking on our block is free. There is quick access to the Armitage and Fullerton 90/94 exits; other near exit includes the Damen 90/94-South ramp. If riding CTA, we're a 10 minute walk to the blue line and directly on the Armitage bus (73); other near bus routes are Damen (50) and Western (49). To get to the brown line, simply take the 73 bus east and get off at the stop in front of the Armitage station. If you're wanting a Divvy bike or public scooter, we are on the Armitage & Leavitt stop / zone.

Penguin Palace promotes healthy indoor air quality with purifiers in the living room and bedrooms. Humidifiers are also available for those with sleep and sinus issues - let us know upon booking and it will be ready to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Purifiers are all set on auto but feel free to adjust using the remote. 

More than likely, we will be here during your stay. During the work week, we cook dinner most nights and welcome you to join us if hungry. During the weekend, we tend to be lazy in the mornings before running errands or heading out.

The building's washer/dryer is free to use and shared with other tenants on a first come, first served basis. Feel free to use our laundry items.

access: You have access to the home, balcony, full gym, and laundry facilities.
description:
Welcome to our Penthouse Loft in the heart of Chicago! When you are here, you have a walk score of 97 and a transit score of 100 to get whereever your trip leads you.

Guests love our home because:
-Lots of natural light
-High loft ceilings
-FAST WIFI
-Spacious layout
-Comfy beds
-Central Location
-Private Balcony!
-Close proximity to Grant Park, Soldier Field, Museums, and more!

We look forward to having you at our home!

(Pssst... Quick favor if you're thinking about booking: Please read the entire listing as it likely answers any questions you may have. Thanks!) 

To access the building, we give you a simple code to go in-and-out as you please. You walk up the stairs to the elevators, and take the elevator to the top floor, the 8th floor.

When you exit the elevator, you turn right and then left down the hallway to your home. When you enter the home, it opens to an open, spacious loft. There is a dining area, a kitchen, a living room, a half bathroom,and private patio for those staying on the first level. The private patio gives you a fresh feel and a cool cityscape view.

If you walk up to the 2nd floor, you will find a spacious loft with two full size beds, a huge closet, and a full bathroom. This is truly a special place, and we look forward to making your stay a 5-star experience!

FAQs
Q: Is the neighborhood safe?
A: Very much so. 24 hours a day.

Q: PARKING?
A: The home is very easy to get to via public transit. If you decide to drive, we recommend apps like SpotAngel or SpotHero to find free or cheap parking ($10-20 / night). 

Q: Do I need to bring towels, a hair dryer, or linens?
A: Nope! we provide all these things. Same with hotel-size toiletries (unless I happen to be out, which is rare).

Q: When can I check in or check out? 
A: Check in is 4pm and check out is 10am. Early check ins can be difficult if there are guests who checked out same day. We ask for an early check-in, or a late-check out fee, if you request either.

Q: Can I come and go as I please?
A: Yes. And we wouldn't trust any listing with which this isn't the case.

Q: Is the place professionally cleaned between guests?
A: Yes, and we take pride in providing a clean home for guests.

Q: What's my total booking price? 
A: We honestly have no idea. With fees included, it only shows the guest how much they pay. This figure should be present after you enter your dates. Note that, pricing varies on a daily basis, and it actually uses some crazy algorithm to adjust it automatically, so I don't actually control this.

Q: Are the beds comfortable?
A: Very. Some guests say they're the best they've ever slept on!

You have access to the home, balcony, full gym, and laundry facilities.

We're here to help as you need it! We give all of our guests full itinerary for their trip 2 days before their stay.

Printers Row is ‚Äúpocket‚Äù neighborhood just minutes from the Chicago Loop. After the Great Chicago Fire of 1871, the area became the Midwest hub of the printing industry with historically significant buildings designed by legendary architects like Daniel Burnham, William Holabird and William Le Baron Jenney. Today, many of those historic buildings remain but the quiet, tree lined streets are now largely residential. Of course, it continues to be a draw for fans of Chicago architecture.

During the day, the neighborhood is an easy walk to offices in the Loop, off Michigan Avenue, or in LaSalle Street financial centers. After hours, the district is alive with restaurants, boutiques, book and antique stores.

It boasts famous blues clubs, eclectic music venues and neighborhood taverns where residents gather. It also has an annual book fair: The Printers Row Book Fair gathers authors, poets, speakers and, of course, books.

Printer's Row is also walking distance to Chicago's Museum Campus, with the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium, and the newly redesigned Soldier Field.

With a 97 walk score and 100 transit score, you can get everywhere your heart desires in Chicago. The Red Line subway is one of the main subways in Chicago, and is only a block away. Many restaurants, shopping, parks, and museums are within walking distance.

No local guests
$500 smoking fee

description:
Disney themed studio in-law apartment with private entrance and designated parking. 
Ouiet neighborhood.  Queen bed, futon and single air mattress available. Close to shopping and great restaurants.

Great for longer stays, very roomy and comfortable.

washer & dryer available on request

We would love to greet you upon arrival show you the apartment and give you the key code. We would love to get to know our guests but we also respect your privacy.

Quiet neighborhood, great shopping & restaurant nearby.

We are located 25 miles west of Chicago,  10 miles from O'hare airport ,10 minutes from nearest train station. 7 minutes from woodfield mall in Schaumburg.

description:
The building is located in the desirable area right between Lincoln Park/DePaul and Lake View and it has been freshly gutted rehabbed. There is a Samsung Smart tv connected to Free High-speed Internet in the unit and complementary Netflix on it. 24/7 exceptional exercise room. Onsite laundry facility and bike room. There‚Äôs no limit to great restaurants and shops around this neighborhood.

Full amenity building with 24/7 fitness center, laundry room, and free high-speed internet and complimentary Netflix.

Ones your booking is confirmed you can find check-in instructions 48 h before arrival in your itinerary. Late check-in no problem/lockbox with keys.
You will have the entire place for yourself.

I am available to answer any questions or concerns if you message me on Airbnb

We are in the Lincoln Park neighborhood, a short walk to DePaul University and public transportation.

The Diversey Brown Line is just 0.5miles away so it's a short walk to it or you can hop on Bus 76 which stops right by the building for one stop. Uber, Lyft, taxi, and bike.

Quiet hours 10pm-6am

access: You'll have the whole 1st floor private apartment to yourself!
description:
Spacious and private 2 bedroom apartment with open floor plan on a quiet street. 3.5 miles from downtown, 1 block from a bus stop, 6 blocks from L train. Private parking.

The house is on a quiet street, with a couple of company buildings in the area. Neighborhood is diverse. It is also right by the University of Illinois In Chicago and about 1 mile from United Center. It is very close to Chicago medical district ( UIC, Cook, RUSH hospitals). Easy access to buses and trains that take you straight downtown. Please note, I do not have a dishwasher!

You'll have the whole 1st floor private apartment to yourself!

Check in is anytime after 3pm and check out is 11 AM.

Not much going on in this neighborhood but there is a bus one block away that takes you right to downtown. Blue line train stop is 6 blocks away. We are only 3.5 miles from downtown and near a major expressway. A couple of grocery stores are about a mile away. You can take a bus there or drive. A convenient Chinese take out place and Subway sandwich place  are around the corner. Little Italy is near by, a couple of cute breakfast places nearby. United Center is one mile away, Rush, Cook, UIC hospitals are less than a mile.

The "L" train (blue line) is 6 blocks away. ( 15 minute train ride to downtown)
The bus 157 stop is a block away and it takes you right downtown. 
3 miles to downtown.
Private parking included.

Some  kitchen necessities provided. (utensils, plates, pan, pot and such+ coffee machine with coffee necessities.)
Towels for 4 people provided.
1 outdoor parking spot available. Otherwise, free  street parking is available.  (and not too hard to find a spot).

access: Enter through building's main door.  Condo is on the 2nd floor. You will receive keys to the Condo upon arrival.
description:
This spacious condo is in the heart of Little India, within walking distance to excellent restaurants of various Asian/Indian and American cuisines, Boutiques and cultural centers.  

Nearby public transportation,  just minutes from the lakefront,  Wrigley Field, downtown or the museum district.

Modern 1500+ sqft  open concept w/2BR 2BA, office space with PC and printer,  large kitchen with nook, living room/entertainment areas with 2 smart TVs.

Enter through building's main door.  Condo is on the 2nd floor. You will receive keys to the Condo upon arrival.

You will enjoy full privacy,  but if you need anything you can message me.

1 block away from the bus stop. You can take the CTA bus, bus #155 Devon to Loyola Train Station (About 20-25 mins). Take the Red Line Train Downtown (About 30-45 mins).

additional_house_rules:
- Quiet hrs. are from 11pm - 7am. Smoking allowed in front or on the back porch. Please leave your shoes in front of the front door if it's wet outside. Return things in the kitchen to where you found them or ask if you forget where they came from. If I'm not around, just do your best or leave whatever it is on the butcher block counter.
Cleaning fee is a one time fee. I ask people to care for their linens if their stays last longer than a week.
Perhaps these requests are obvious to some however since it isn't to all, here you go. I appreciate your consideration towards the communal nature of your stay here. I tried to create as upscale environment within the confines of a vintage building with upgrading the bathrooms and kitchen.  Please be considerate of others during your stay (other than food in the fridge) please keep your personal belongings in your bedroom when your not using them.
When you're finished preparing your meals, remove any food from contact with counters. 
When your done cleaning dishes and counters etc. Squeeze the water out of the sponge (to avoid moldy smell).
If you're sharing the bathroom please be considerate of other people using it after you and leave it clean for the next user.

access: Living room lounge area, dining room, kitchen and porch (season permitting ) are all accessible to guests and of course, you're always welcome to hunker down in your room.
description:
Extended stay prices negotiable. Trains are a seven to eight minute walk. Vintage building with modern updates for the bathrooms and kitchen. Everyone has been commenting on how well they've slept in our beds. Each room has been addressed so that your endeavors will be easily supported during your stay. Active, friendly and diverse community with the added plus of being so close to the lake and it's seasonal changes. Great for walking both for the architecture and the lakefront.

I have carefully considered each room along with how people want to work, eat, socialize, hide out or just relax.  I intentionally constructed my home in a way that sets the stage for people who appreciate art, culture and aesthetics  in general in an attempt to elevate the communal experience. There are three airbnb bedrooms, if you are interested in seeing the others I will be happy to send their names so you can find them online. Cleaning fee is a one time fee. Please note, I ask people to care of their linens if their stays last longer than a week.
My art studio coexists within the living room space. There is a decent amount of room here making it easy to choose to be alone or with people if and when there are others present.

Living room lounge area, dining room, kitchen and porch (season permitting ) are all accessible to guests and of course, you're always welcome to hunker down in your room.

I am happy to help you find things here at my home and out in the city. Feel free to ask, text or call.

Culturally rich, economically diverse historic, lakefront neighborhood.  Between Loyola University to the south and Northwestern University to the north -- students, families, mature trees, stunning views.  Good local restaurants, bars, vibes.  Down home, soulful; close to downtown Evanston and easy access to all Chicago has to offer via train, buses Lyft, Uber, and rentable Divvy bicycles throughout Chicago‚Äôs neighborhoods.

‚Ä¢ Buses down the block take you Downtown and the bus has rush hour express times.
‚Ä¢ There are two local train stations, the Jarvis (red line)and the Howard L (red, purple & yellow lines) and a bus (#147) a block away that takes you downtown. The trains are a seven or eight minute walk   
‚Ä¢ I recommend using the "Transit" app. it tells you exact times to start your trips from current locations.
‚Ä¢ Ubers and Lyfts abound as do Divvy bike stations.

The apartment is on the second floor. 
There's parking out front but sometimes you'll need to either park 1/2 a block away due east or north. 
Pets will be considered on an individual basis. If you are planning on bringing your pet(s), please give me a heads up as there will be an additional fee.

Between Loyola University to the south and Northwestern University to the north -- students, families, mature trees, stunning views.  Good local restaurants, bars, vibes.  Down home, soulful; close to downtown Evanston and easy access to all Chicago has to offer via train, buses Lyft, Uber, and rentable Divvy bicycles throughout Chicago‚Äôs neighborhoods.
notes:
The apartment is on the second floor. 
There's parking out front but sometimes you'll need to either park 1/2 a block away due east or north. 
Pets will be considered on an individual basis. If you are planning on bringing your pet(s), please give me a heads up as there will be an additional fee.
space:
I have carefully considered each room along with how people want to work, eat, socialize, hide out or just relax.  I intentionally constructed my home in a way that sets the stage for people who appreciate art, culture and aesthetics  in general in an attempt to elevate the communal experience. There are three airbnb bedrooms, if you are interested in seeing the others I will be happy to send their names so you can find them online. Cleaning fee is a one time fee. Please note, I ask people to care of their linens if their stays last longer than a week.
My art studio coexists within the living room space. There is a decent amount of room here making it easy to choose to be alone or with people if and when there are others present.
summary: Extended stay prices negotiable. Trains are a seven to eight minute walk. Vintage building with modern updates for the bathrooms and kitchen. Everyone has been commenting on how well they've slept in our beds. Each room has been addressed so that your endeavors will be easily supported during your stay. Active, friendly and diverse community with the added plus of being so close to the lake and it's seasonal changes. Great for walking both for the architecture and the lakefront.
transit:
‚Ä¢ Buses down the block take you Downtown and the bus has rush hour express times.
‚Ä¢ There are two local train stations, the Jarvis (red line)and the Howard L (red, purple & yellow lines) and a bus (#147) a block away that takes you downtown. The trains are a seven or eight minute walk   
‚Ä¢ I recommend using the "Transit" app. it tells you exact times to start your trips from current locations.
‚Ä¢ Ubers and Lyfts abound as do Divvy bike stations.

access: Access to the apartment, shared hallway and entrance.
description:
A charming walk up 3 bedroom/ 1.5 bath apartment on the 3rd floor of a vintage building in the Lincoln Park neighborhood across from DePaul University.  
Bright and sunny, this unit has 2 skylights and large windows that overlook the neighborhood, an open floor plan and easy access to a great area. Perfect for students and families visiting the university, and a quick 2 block walk to the CTA train.

We live on the 2nd floor with our children and there are other permanent tenants in the building

An entire apartment:  3 bedroom,  1.5 bath private apartment, 3rd floor walk up in a vintage building. The first floor is our family-run costume shop on a busy neighborhood street!

Access to the apartment, shared hallway and entrance.

We are available onsite almost all the time during your stay

Lincoln Park is one of Chicago's top neighborhoods, everything from bars and restaurants to clubs and theater all in walking distance

There is free street parking in front of the building on the north side of the street, though it can be tough sometimes to find a spot.  Also paid street parking acrross the street on the south side of Fullerton- and a paid parking lot at the university.  We are 2 blocks from the Chicago EL CTA  Red, Brown and Purple line trains at the Fullerton station.

Other long term tenants live in the building, we operate the costume shop on the first floor.

description:
A private bedroom in a two bedroom apartment located in Chicago's Marshall Square/Pilsen/Douglas Park neighborhood.

The apartment was completely renovated during the past year and is located on the first floor of a three story century old vintage brick building, locally known as a three flat. Redone in the style of a "soft loft" the unit has 10 foot ceilings, spiral duct work, newly refinished hardwood maple floors and an exposed brick wall in the kitchen. This bedroom is one of two in the apartment and has a queen size bed and  a large walk in closet. The apartment is shared- at a maximum - with one other person. Each guest has their own bedroom. Each bedroom door has a keyed lock.

I am always available by text, email or phone.

Marshall Square, adjacent to the better known Pilsen area, was settled and built largely by Czechs in the later part of the 19th  and early 20th century. Buildings are almost exclusively brick with attractive facades and are separated by narrow "gangways". While not one of Chicago's trendier areas, transportation links into the Loop are excellent, with a train station at the end of the block and less than a 20 minute ride to the Loop. The neighborhood is predominately Mexican now, with many excellent and inexpensive restaurants. Laguinitas Brewery and Pub is just a few blocks away as is Cinespace Movie Studio, where several network and cable tv shows are filmed.

The apartment is located less than a block from the California Pink Line elevated stop which is 20 minutes from the Loop. There are two grocery stores, a Walmart, a Planet Fitness, three laundromats and many restaurants within a short walking distance from the building.

For medical students completing a clinical rotation: St. Anthony's Hospital is around the corner, Mt. Sinai Hospital is six blocks away, and the Illinois Medical District (Rush, University of Illinois, Stroger and Jesse Brown Hospitals) are just 4 stops away (8 minutes)   on the Pink line El .
